command.name: event_search
command.doc: This method uses Eventbrite search index to find publicly listed events.

param.name: keywords
param.doc: The search keywords. To run an OR search, you need this format: 'keywords=google%20OR%20multimedia'

param.name: category
param.doc: Event categories (comma seperated): conference, conventions, entertainment, fundraisers, meetings, other, performances, reunions, sales, seminars, social, sports, tradeshows, travel, religion, fairs, food, music, recreation.

param.name: address
param.doc: The venue address.

param.name: city
param.doc: The venue city.

param.name: region
param.doc: The venue state/province/county/territory depending on the country. 2-letter state code is required for US addresses.

param.name: postal_code
param.doc: The postal/zip code of the venue.

param.name: country
param.doc: 2-letter country code, according to the ISO 3166 format.

param.name: within
param.doc: If “within” is set and the “city” or “zipcode” resolve to a specific geolocation, the search will be restricted to the specified within radius. The sorting default will be set to “distance”.

param.name: within_unit
param.doc: If within is set, you can specify the unit to use: “M” for miles, or “K” for kilometers. By default, the API will use miles.

param.name: latitude
param.doc: If “within” is set you can limit your search to wgs84 coordinates (latitude, Longitude).

param.name: longitude
param.doc: If “within” is set you can limit your search to wgs84 coordinates (latitude, Longitude).

param.name: date
param.doc: The event start date. Limit the list of results to a date range, specified by a label or by exact dates. Currently supported labels include: “All”, “Future”, “Past”, “Today”, “Yesterday”, “Last Week”, “This Week”, “Next week”, “This Month”, “Next Month” and months by name, e.g. “October”. Exact date ranges take the form “YYYY-MM-DD YYYY-MM-DD”, e.g. “2008-04-25 2008-04-27″.

param.name: date_created
param.doc: The date range the event was created, specified by a label or by exact dates. Currently supported labels include: “Today”, “Yesterday”, “Last Week”, “This Week”, “This Month”. Exact date ranges take the form “YYYY-MM-DD YYYY-MM-DD”, e.g. “2008-04-25 2008-04-27″.

param.name: date_modified
param.doc: The date the event was last modified, specified by a label or by exact dates. Currently supported labels include: “Today”, “Yesterday”, “Last Week”, “This Week”, “This Month”. Exact date ranges take the form “YYYY-MM-DD YYYY-MM-DD”, e.g. “2008-04-25 2008-04-27″.

param.name: organizer
param.doc: The organizer name.

param.name: max
param.doc: Limit the number of events returned. Maximum limit is 100 events per page. Default is 10.

param.name: count_only
param.doc: Only return the total number of events (“true” or “false”). Default is “false”.

param.name: sort_by
param.doc: Sort the list of events by “id”, “date”, “name”, “city”. The default is “date”.

param.name: page
param.doc: Allows for paging through the results of a query. Default is 1.

param.name: since_id
param.doc: Returns events with id greater than “since_id” value. Default is 1.

param.name: tracking_link
param.doc: The tracking link code to add to the event URLs.

command.name: event_get
command.doc: This method returns the identified event resource along with any associated ticket, venue, or organizer profile objects. Only public events details are returned if no additional authentication tokens are supplied.

param.name: id
param.doc: The ID of the requested event.

command.name: event_new
command.doc: This method creates a new event, returning the ID of the newly created resource.

param.name: title
param.doc: The event title. 255 characters max.

param.name: description
param.doc: The event description.

param.name: start_date
param.doc: The event start date and time, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., 2007-12-31 23:59:59).

param.name: end_date
param.doc: The event end date and time, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., 2007-12-31 23:59:59).

param.name: timezone
param.doc: The event time zone in relation to GMT (e.g., GMT+01, GMT+02, GMT-01).

param.name: privacy
param.doc: 0 for a private event, 1 for a public event. If not provided, will default to 0.

param.name: personalized_url
param.doc: The event registration URL. If you pass “testevent”, the event will be accessible at http://testevent.eventbrite.com. This string is limited to 255 characters max.

param.name: venue_id
param.doc: The event venue ID. The venue must have been previously created using /venue_new.

param.name: organizer_id
param.doc: The event organizer ID. The organizer must have been previously created using /organizer_new.

param.name: capacity
param.doc: The maximum number of people who can attend the event.

param.name: currency
param.doc: The event currency in ISO 4217 format (e.g., USD, EUR).

param.name: status
param.doc: The event status. Allowed values are draft, live for new events. If not provided, status will be draft, meaning that the event registration page will not be available publicly.

param.name: custom_header
param.doc: Custom HTML header for your registration page.

param.name: custom_footer
param.doc: Custom HTML footer for your registration page.

param.name: background_color
param.doc: Custom hexadecimal color for your registration page. Format: FFFFFF without the pound

param.doc: Custom hexadecimal color for your registration page. Format: FFFFFF without the pound

command.name: event_copy
command.doc: This method duplicates an existing event, returning the ID of the new event. Events can not be copied from one user account to another.

param.name: id
param.doc: The ID of the existing event.

param.name: event_name
param.doc: A new name for this copy of the Event. 255 character limit.
